Posts.Content: Thanks! I do know some local holistic people so I will check with them first!
Posts.Title: frankincense oil

Posts.Content: Hi, I was wondering for those of you with bone mets...what supplements are you taking to build your bone strength? I have heard different things about calcium and you don't want to take too much calcium? I know calcium is just one of the MANY minerals that actually build bone stength. I get so confused sometimes with all of this information of what to take and not to take! Any suggestions?
Posts.Title: Stage 4 Gals with Bone Mets

Posts.Content: On Apr 17, 2016 8:43 AM lamb0301 wrote: I too have a score of 17% and have suffered just minor joint aches and muscle pain from Letrozole.   Moreso was knife-like headaches were I even had a MRI done to check for mets - no mets.  Had my surgery and radiation in summer of 2015.  A nurse in integrative medicine told me because of Letrozole I as depleted in Magnesium.  A health/wellness pharmacist confirmed this along with a depletion of Calcium and Vit D.  He told me to supplement my diet with these minerals (500mg of Mag) and to avoid flaxseed, soy, Vit C, copper, and iron.  Went off Letrozole today to help replenish my minerals then will go back on Letrozole in a week.  This was suggested by another nurse practioner in the field who told me not to tell anyone about this as other patients she knows have done the same with med onc approval.  I am also a Radiation Therapist so I know these hormone drugs help, but maybe their medical makeup has changed where more are getting sicker using these drugs. Hi, I was on Femara and my magnesium, calcium and minerals are low. Why did the health/wellness person tell you to avoid Vit C? I try to stay away from copper as well. I know my iron is low but I don't supplement b/c of the iron/copper ratio. I can't remember exactly but copper is supposed to not be good for those with cancer?
Posts.Title: femara long term effects

Posts.Content: Where do you find the extract? I was going to buy the oil from young living.
